did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Second Church of Christ, Scientist (Hartford, Conn.)

did.unittitle: Second Church of Christ, Scientist records
did.abstract: The Second Church of Christ Scientist Hartford, was organized in 1907 by 11 members of The Mother Church. The first service was held on an upper floor at 64 Pearl Street, and as the congregation grew, services were moved twice to other sites. The church building at the corner of Lafayette and Russ Streets held its first service January 4, 1925. A diminished membership prompted the congregation to sell the church building to the State of Connecticut in 2008.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Second Church of Christ Scientist Hartford, was organized in 1907 by 11 members of The Mother Church. The first service was held on an upper floor at 64 Pearl Street, and as the congregation grew, services were moved twice to other sites. The church building at the corner of Lafayette and Russ Streets held its first service January 4, 1925. A diminished membership prompted the congregation to sell the church building to the State of Connecticut in 2008.
Source: Christian Science in Connecticut, Welcome to Second Church of Christ, Scientist Hartford, Connecticut USA! http://www.christiansciencect.org/hartford2/ (accessed May 23, 2008).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series 1, Governance is comprised mainly of two notebooks. One contains Board standing rules and votes, 1912-1990, and the other contains standing church votes, 1912-1987. Series 2, Membership includes two volumes of church meeting attendance registers, 1921-1938, a monthly envelopes register, 1935-1948, and membership lists for 1996 and 1998. Series 3, Clerk includes the clerk's files. These files contain chiefly correspondence to and from the Board of Directors as well as files for various committees. Series 3 also includes financial records including four ledgers, 1932-1955. Series 4, Committees include minutes and reports of Advertising Information Committee, Circulation Information Committee, House Committee, Literature Distribution Committee, and Sanatorium Information Committee that date primarily from the 1920s to 1960s. There are also single folders for the War Relief Committee, 1941-1945. Of note in Series 5, Sunday School are two volumes of teachers' meeting minutes, 1914-1925.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Second Church of Christ, Scientist (Hartford, Conn.) -- Records and correspondence
Church records and registers -- Connecticut -- Hartford

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The State Library acquired these records in 2008 after the congregation sold the church building to the State of Connecticut.

bioghist.p: The Real estate marketing book was created to interest potential buyers.

scopecontent.p: It shows interior views of the church and exterior views of the church and surrounding area.
